info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 10 at 2:41PM MST until August 10 at 5:00PM MST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON FOR SOUTH CENTRAL MOHAVE COUNTY... At 241 PM MST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the southern end of the Hualapai Mountains. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen, with the heaviest rain near Chicken Springs Road. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Alamo Crossing Road and secondary roads around the southern portion of the Hualapai Mountains. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
